question.text: Respiration in insects is known to be direct because

options.text: the tissues exchange <math><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></math> directly with the air in the tracheal tubes

the tissues exchange <math><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></math> directly with the coelomic fluid

the tissues exchange <math><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></math> directly with the air outside through the body surface

the tracheal tubes exchange <math><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></math> directly with the haemocoel which then exchange with tissues

solution.text:
Insects have tubes which act as their respiratory organs. The tissues exchange O2 and CO2 directly with the air in these tubes. Hence, respiration in insects is known as direct respiration.

Tracheal tubes are present as respiratory organs in earthworm.

Amphibians like frog exchange gases with air outside through their body surface.
